column4: Can I remove linux-image-2.6.27-13-generic if I am using the newest kernel now?
you mean from grub, or the image file itself?

If you believe that the new kernel will work without any hiccups, sure.  Just make sure that you remove the entry out of /boot/grub/menu.lst as well to ensure that you dont accidentally try to boot to that image file.
i think that if i remove the file, it will remove the entry also...So it's secure to remove those files? :)
yes.  I have removed mine in the past without problems.
and now that I think of it, I dont remember if I had to remove the entry out of grub.
linux-headers are safe to remove too?
it should be safe to remove linux headers, but I have never personally done so, so I cannot vouch for that
everything went smooth, entries removed automatically. I left the last one, just for the case the new doesn't work well ;)
look at the comment left by bubble
and Paddy_EIRE just confirmed it.  removing linux headers is a-ok.
